intro: Chamaesyce inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are usually lobed and can be hairy, while its stems are often prostrate or creeping. Chamaesyce inaequalis is an important component of coastal dune ecosystems, contributing to soil stabilization and providing habitat for various small organisms.
